New Documentary Film Produced 
   Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Korean Documentary and Scientific Film Studio has recently produced a documentary film "Sincere Help to Army."
 The film truthfully represents the sincere devotion made by the Korean people to assisting the army, true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.    
 The film has scenes showing a great many families sharing kindred feelings with soldiers and people of different social standings who find the worth of their living in helping the army, regarding it as their most beautiful tradition to help the army, those deeply respecting the war veterans who courageously fought during the war and taking good care of honored disabled soldiers to enable them to keep the flowers of revolution on the road of Songun as they did when they were soldiers and the admirable deeds and proud features of young people in various parts of the country leaving to different posts for defending the country, deeming their service in the army as their greatest honor in the Songun era.

DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Supported in Indonesia
articles.content:
Korean People's Greatest Holidays to Be Commemorated in Peru 
   Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 was formed with due ceremony in Lima on Jan. 2. 
 The ceremony elected Secretary General of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship Yuri Cesar Castro Romero, Chairman of the New Left Movement of Peru Alberto Moreno Lohas, Chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, General secretary of the Peruvian Communist Party Lenan Raffo Munoz, General secretary of the Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru Victor Oliva Miguel, General Secretary of the Socialist Party of Peru Luis Mateo Munoz, President of the General Kim Jong Il Peruvian Amicable Institute Jose Antonio Gamarra Puertas who is chairman of the National Association of Writers and Artists of Peru, Chairman of the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea Tani Baler Lopera and Chairwoman of the Tomasa Titu Conde Maita Women's Association P. Romero co-chairpersons of the preparatory committee.    
 It fixed the period from February to April as a commemoration period and decided to organize diverse political and cultural events in the capital and local areas during the period.
